heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: It is currently one of the longest windy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 4 consecutive days where it has been windy starting on 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.9 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 326 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 103 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 326.3m lower than yesterday, 103.2m lower than the past week, 100.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 530m minimum and 1993m maximum, with an average of 684.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 787.6m and 785.4m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and very little to no wind will be present. Some rain can be expected, fog or low cloud is expected, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (97%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
